results.title: Plan for living
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows scenes where early settlers landed in Australia; early views of the cities of Australia; construction of buildings post 1949 and general living conditions and development of the cities of Australia.

results.title: Plan for coal
results.creator_credit: Stuart Legg and Data Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the British coal industry; its history and significance from the first World War, through the depression of the 1930s to the present day. Some indication is given of long-term planning being carried out by the National Coal Board for the stabilisation and modernisation of the industry. Shows some of the new equipment being used. Narrated by Howard Crawford, Michael Goodliffe.

results.title: Places people live: seacoast people
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Depicts a day in the life of a lobster fisherman in York Harbor, Maine. Shows the similar methods of harvesting coastal waters used by a Norwegian crab fisherman. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Place value: ones, tens, hundreds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Paul shows Judy how to group pennies into tens and hundreds in order to count them. Small card holders are used to record and demonstrate the meaning of place value. Teacher-parent film on infant mathematics. Suitable for lower primary and teacher levels.

results.title: Place for a village
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Some unique sites are shown in this film, including the Russell Street Police Station, the Museum, the State Library, Government House, Captain Cook’s Cottage, Melbourne High and Grammar Schools, an Italian restaurant with a dinner and a show, the suburb of Toorak and the Holden GM factory. This film also opens to some aerial footage from the era of the inner city blocks. Commentary by Harry Dearth.

This film also opens to some aerial footage from the era of the inner city blocks. Commentary by Harry Dearth.

results.title: Pisa: story of a cathedral square = Storia di una piazza: la piazza di Pisa
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti, Este Film and Romor Film
results.brief_description: Spanning three centuries in construction, 1000 to 1300 AD, buildings of Cathedral Square in Pisa were planned to beautify an important sea-port. The relationship between the Cathedral, the Baptistry, the leaning tower and the Campo Santo is emphasised by the photography.
results.title_for_label: Pisa: story of a cathedral square = Storia di una piazza: la piazza di Pisa

results.title: Pirate ship
results.creator_credit: Frank Moser, Paul Terry and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Short animation with some live action and songs. A gang of pirates hold s young damsel hostage. She is rescued when the US navy sends a convoy of warships to destroy the pirates. They then sing a tribute to the glorious red, white and blue. Story is framed by having two characters of indeterminate species reading the story of the pirate ship. The female asks the male if he would rescue her they way the story hero recused the damsel. He says he would.
